item.title: Handshake Dialect Rationale
item.description: Principle Choice of MLIR IR Representation Conventions Resources Operation definitions This document also explains in a high-level manner how different components are organized, the principles behind them and the conventions we followed. The document assume that you have basic understanding of asynchronous digital circuits at the behavioral level of abstraction. Principle Handshake/dataflow IR describes independent, unsynchronized processes communicating data through First-in First-out (FIFO) communication channels. This can be implemented in many ways, such as using synchronous logic, or with processors.
